src:
Liga 1: Persipura dan Talenta Bola Papua yang Sempat Tenggelam
04 Nov 2019, 07:22 by Tempo.co, Hari Prasetyo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Alam di Papua membentuk orang-orangnya dengan fisik yang kuat. Itu modal dasar buat pemain sepak bola. Kebangkitan Persipura Jayapura dalam paruh kedua kompetisi Liga 1 Indonesia 2019 mengingatkan kembali tentang sosok tim berjuluk Mutiara Hitam itu dalam sejarah sepak bola Indonesia.
Para periode 1970-an, tim nasional Indonesia memiliki pemain bek kanan yang legendaris kelahiran Manokwari, Papua, Yohanes Auri. Pada era itu salah satu pelatih asing terbaik yang pernah menangani tim nasional Indonesia, Wiel Coerver, mengungkapkan rasa takjubnya melihat talenta-talenta sepak bola di Papua.
Selain Yohanes Auri, ada Timo Kapisa, Adolf Kabo yang ikut membawa tim Indonesia menembus semifinal Asian Games 1986, dan sejumlah nama lainnya.
Dan, di skuad Persipura sekarang masih ada mantan kapten tim nasional Indonesia, Boaz Solossa.
Setelah sempat “menghilang” sebentar, Persipura yang dulu langganan juara pada era Liga Indonesia, kini seperti menemukan momentumnya untuk mencuat lagi di tangan Jacksen F. Tiago. Pria asal Brasil yang sudah malang-melintang di Indonesia sebagai pemain maupun pelatih tampaknya yang paling cocok menangani tim Mutiara Hitam ini.
Kemenangan Persipura Jayapura melawan Madura United dengan skor 2-0 di Stadion Gelora Bangkalan, Minggu malam, 3 November 2019, menjadi penegas kebangkitan mereka. Kini Boaz Solossa dan kawan-kawan menemparti peringkat ketiga dari 18 tim yang ada di Liga 1 2019.
Dalam pertandingan Minggu malam lalu itu, dua gol kemenangan Persipura dicetak M. Tahir pada menit ketiga dan dan Titus Bonai menit 74.
Di situs Liga Indonesia, Jacksen F. Tiago mengungkapkan rasa syukur bahwa anak asuhnya dapat melenjutkan tren posirif menjadi enam laga tak terkalahkan. Namun, dia mengakui, kemenangan tersebut hampir sirna lantaran babak kedua gawang Boaz Solossa cs dibombardir.
"Bersyukur malam ini, kami bisa menang, meskipun babak kedua gawang kami dibombandir, tapi Tuhan masih sayang kami dan usaha keras anak-anak tidak sia-sia," kata Jacksen.
Sukses mengamankan poin maksimal, arsitek berdarah Brasil itu menjelaskan, tidak terlepas dari buah mempelajari kemampuan Madura United, terutama mengantisipasi magis trio depan lawan, Aleksandar Rakic, Greg Nwokolo, dan Andik Vermansyah.
"Sebenarnya, kami melakukan persiapan hampir seminggu di Kota Surabaya khusus untuk menghadapi situasi yang berbahaya dari Madura (United), sehingga anak-anak mampu mengantisipasi, seperti situasi dari Greg, Rakic, dan Andik," kata Jacksen, ikon Persebaya pada masa lalu.
Selain itu, mantan juru taktik Barito Putera tersebut menilai, anak asuhnya disiplin dan militan dalam menghadapi tim berjuluk Laskar Sape Kerrab.
"Semua itu berkat disiplin dari militansi pemain kami di pertandingan hari ini. Kami mengapresiasi setinggi-tingginya kepada anak-anak Persipura," kata Jacksen F. Tiago.
Masih ada 10 pertandingan buat Persipura Jayapura untuk menyelesaikan kiprahnya di Liga 1 musim ini. Jika mereka bisa menggeser Madura United dan Bali United dari dua posisi teratas, itu akan menjadi catatan penting buat Mutiara Hitam ini dan Jacksen F. Tiago.
text:
League 1: Persipura and the Talent of the Papuan Ball that Has Drowned
04 Nov 2019, 07:22 by Tempo.co, Hari Prasetyo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Nature in Papua shapes its people with a strong physique. That's the basic capital for soccer players. The revival of Persipura Jayapura in the second half of the 2019 Indonesia League 1 competition recalls the figure of the team nicknamed the Black Pearl in the history of Indonesian football.
In the 1970s, the Indonesian national team had a legendary right-back player born in Manokwari, Papua, Yohanes Auri. In that era, one of the best foreign coaches who ever handled the Indonesian national team, Wiel Coerver, expressed his amazement to see the talents of football in Papua.
Besides Yohanes Auri, there was Timo Kapisa, Adolf Kabo who helped bring the Indonesian team through the 1986 Asian Games semifinals, and a number of other names.
And, in the Persipura squad there is still a former Indonesian national team captain, Boaz Solossa.
After briefly "disappearing", Persipura, who had been a champion of the Indonesian League era, now seemed to find its momentum to re-emerge in the hands of Jacksen F. Tiago. The man from Brazil, who has crossed over in Indonesia as a player or coach, seems the most suitable to handle this Black Pearl team.
Jayapura Persipura victory against Madura United with a score of 2-0 at the Bangkalan Stadium on Sunday night, November 3, 2019, reinforced their resurrection. Now Boaz Solossa and his friends rank third in the 18 teams in 2019 in League 1.
In last Sunday night's match, two goals from Persipura won M. Tahir in the third minute and Titus Bonai in the 74th minute.
On the Indonesian League website, Jacksen F. Tiago expressed his gratitude that his team could foster a positive trend to six matches unbeaten. However, he admitted, the victory almost vanished because the second half of the Boaz Solossa cs goal was bombarded.
"Grateful tonight, we can win, even though the second half of our goal is bombarded, but God still loves us and the children's efforts are not in vain," Jacksen said.
Success in securing maximum points, the Brazilian architect explained, is inseparable from the fruit of learning the ability of Madura United, especially anticipating the magical trio ahead of opponents, Aleksandar Rakic, Greg Nwokolo, and Andik Vermansyah.
"Actually, we made almost a week of preparation in the city of Surabaya specifically to deal with dangerous situations from Madura (United), so that children are able to anticipate, such as the situation of Greg, Rakic and Andik," said Jacksen, icon of Persebaya in the past.
In addition, the former Barito Putera tactician said that his foster children were disciplined and militant in facing the team nicknamed Laskar Sape Kerrab.
"All of that is thanks to the discipline of our players' militancy in today's match. We highly appreciate the children of Roma," said Jacksen F. Tiago.
There are still 10 matches for Persipura Jayapura to complete their work in League 1 this season. If they can shift Madura United and Bali United from the top two positions, it will be an important note for this Black Pearl and Jacksen F. Tiago.
